oSU_B3RrfpFt.code:
// @title 251201A Slow Attack Sawtooth
// @by Gavin Rough <https://grough.com>
// @license CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

note("<c3 bb2 f3 eb3>")
.sound("sawtooth")
.lpf(8000)
.gain(0.5)
.adsr("1.0 : 1.0 : 0.5 : 5.0")
.room(2)
.delay(0.5)
.delaysync(1/8.1)
.delayfeedback(0.8)
._spectrum()

t8CUhf332893.code:
// @title 251202D Aliasing Sawtooth Sequence
// @by Gavin Rough <https://grough.com>
// @license CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

note(
  "[c4]*16"
    .scale("C:pentatonic")
    .scaleTranspose(saw.range(-12, 24).fast(123.123))
)
  .clip(saw.range(0.0, 1.25).fast(1001))
  .velocity(saw.range(0.0, 1.0).fast(123.6))
  .decay(saw.range(0.05, 0.12).fast(686.6))
  .sustain(0.1)
  .release(saw.range(0.1, 2.0).fast(76.62))
  .bpf(saw.range(250, 800).fast(276.62))
  .bpq(saw.range(2, 10).fast(376.62))
  .sound("sawtooth")
  .postgain(2)

Msr-pUtQU032.code:
// @title 251204B Richter Flat Source
// @by Gavin Rough <https://grough.com>
// @details Take 251204A and make the code more compact.

setcpm(87/4)

n(
  cat(
  `
  0  4  9  3 -1  4  8  2
 -3  3  6  2 -2  3  7  2
  0  5  9  4 -1  3  8  4
 -3  2  6  1 -2  2  7  3
  0  4  9  5  1  6  10 4
  2  6 10  4  1  6  11 7
  0  5  9  4  1  6  10 4
  2  6 11  7 -1  3  8  4
  `
  .slow(16), "~@4")
)
.scale("Bb:minor")
.sound("piano").lpf(250)

NIVEEqAxR3bN.code:
// @title 251204D
// @by Gavin Rough <https://grough.com>
// @details Cover of the song "To The Lighthouse"
setcpm(118/4)

const one = n(cat(`
-2 -2 2 2 3 3 4 4 6 6 7 7 8 8 11 11
`)).slow(2)
.scale("D:minor")
.sound("piano").lp(250).gain(1)

const twoRight = n(cat(`
11 11 9 9 7 7 5 5 4 4 7 7 5 5 2 2
`)).slow(2)
.scale("C:minor")
.sound("piano").lp(250).gain(1)

const twoLeft = n(cat(`
2 2 -2 -2 0 0 -5 -5 -2 -2 0 0 -4 -4 _ _
`)).slow(2)
.scale("C:minor")
.sound("piano").lp(250).gain(1)

const three = n(cat(`
-8 -8 -4 -4 -3 -3 -1 -1 0 0 1 1 3 3 4 4
`)).slow(2)
.scale("A:minor")
.sound("piano").lp(250).gain(1)

const four = n(cat(`
-8 -8 -4 -4 -3 -3 -1 -1 0 0 -1 -1 1 1 -1 -1
`)).slow(2)
.scale("A:minor")
.sound("piano").lp(250).gain(1)

arrange(
  [8, one],
  [8, stack(twoRight, twoLeft)],
  [8, three],
  [4, four],
)
